info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 12:55AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THURSDAY TO 5 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 10 inches possible. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Gates of the Mountains and Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Friday afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM Thursday to 5 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
